title: Authors and Citation
text: Gambarota F (2025). filor: Personal collection useful functions. R package version 0.1.0, https://filippogambarota.github.io/filor/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {filor: Personal collection of useful functions},   author = {Filippo Gambarota},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://filippogambarota.github.io/filor/}, }

title: Personal collection of useful functions
text: can install development version filor GitHub :

title: I2 — I2
text: tau2 heterogeneity vi typical sampling variability

what: Calculate Standard Error (SE) associated with a desired level of statistical power — SE4power
title: Calculate Standard Error (SE) associated with a desired level of statistical power — SE4power
text: Calculate Standard Error (SE) associated given power given alpha level given value model parameter B

title: Calculate Standard Error (SE) associated with a desired level of statistical power — SE4power
Calculate Standard Error (SE) associated with a desired level of statistical power — SE4power
text: power desired level statistical power alpha alpha level (rate type errors) alternative Whether statistical test two sided one sided. Must one "two.sided" (default) "one.sided" B model parameter B (practically, effect size)

title: Calculate Standard Error (SE) associated with a desired level of statistical power — SE4power
text: numerical value Standard Error (SE) associated arguments

title: add_random_na — add_random_na
text: put random NA values within dataframe teaching testing purposes.

title: add_random_na — add_random_na
text: data dataframe n number NA values insert exclude_cols string vector strings column exclude NA filling

title: all_same — all_same
text: Check values vector . robust also NA values can handled na.rm parameter

title: all_same — all_same
text: x vector na.rm logical indicating whether NA values removed .

title: all_same — all_same
code: all_same(c(1,1,1))  # TRUE #> [1] TRUE all_same(c(1,2,3))  # FALSE #> [1] FALSE all_same(c(1,1,NA)) # FALSE #> [1] FALSE all_same(c(1,1,NA), na.rm = TRUE) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE

title: cap_link — cap_link
text: link character. web address text charactet. text displayed. Default NULL thus link

what: Filter a List by Class — cfilter
title: Filter a List by Class — cfilter
text: Filters list, keeping excluding elements based class.

title: Filter a List by Class — cfilter
Filter a List by Class — cfilter
text: x list R objects. class character string specifying class filter . Logical; `TRUE`, elements ** inheriting `class` kept. Default `FALSE`.

title: Filter a List by Class — cfilter
text: list containing elements `x` () inherit specified class.

title: Filter a List by Class — cfilter
code: lst <- list(1L, "text", 3.14, list(a = 1)) cfilter(lst, "numeric")  # returns elements that are numeric #> [[1]] #> [1] 3.14 #>  cfilter(lst, "character")  # returns character elements #> [[1]] #> [1] "text" #>  cfilter(lst, "numeric", not = TRUE)  # returns elements that are NOT numeric #> [[1]] #> [1] 1 #>  #> [[2]] #> [1] "text" #>  #> [[3]] #> [[3]]$a #> [1] 1 #>  #>

code: cinorm(x = NULL, se = NULL, avg = NULL, interval = 0.95)

title: cinorm — cinorm
text: x vector se standard error avg mean interval desired interval

title: closest_number — closest_number
text: Find closest number vector given target number

title: col_has_na — col_has_na
text: Return columns names least one NA value

title: compare_rma — compare_rma
text: Put dataframe one models fitted metafor::rma.uni nice visual comparison.

title: compare_rma — compare_rma
text: ... models compared fitlist list models instead using `...`. `fitlist` provided `...` ignored. extra_params vector (extra) parameters extracted. elements rma.uni objects.

title: conditional — conditional
text: Function create wrapper version input function run according logical condition. Useful conditional pipelines. see https://community.rstudio.com/t/conditional-pipelines/6076/2

title: coridx — coridx
text: create correlation names given size correlation matrix

what: Create a YAML-style list from a named vector or list — create_yml
title: Create a YAML-style list from a named vector or list — create_yml
text: function takes named vector list converts YAML-style list key–value pairs. element represented `- key: value`. file path provided, YAML output written disk.

title: Create a YAML-style list from a named vector or list — create_yml
Create a YAML-style list from a named vector or list — create_yml
text: x named vector list. names used keys, corresponding values values. `NA` values converted empty strings. file Optional. character string giving path file YAML output written. `NULL` (default), result returned instead written.

title: Create a YAML-style list from a named vector or list — create_yml
text: `file` `NULL`, returns character vector one entry   per YAML item. `file` `NULL`, YAML output written   specified file result returned invisibly.

title: Create a YAML-style list from a named vector or list — create_yml
code:
# Create a simple YAML list from a named vector x <- c(name = "Alice", age = 30, country = NA) create_yml(x) #> [1] "- name: Alice
  age: 30
  country: 
  "

text: Convert factor contrasts representation. works factors two levels.

title: fil — fil
text: Store public info useful within projects

title: filter_output — filter_output
text: x result function capture e.g. summary(x) lines vector line numbers extract pattern "|" regex mapping lines extract. cat logical indicating using cat() output

title: filter_output — filter_output
code: fit <- lm(mpg ~ hp, data = mtcars) filter_output(summary(fit), 1:5) #>  #> Call: #> lm(formula = mpg ~ hp, data = mtcars) #>  #> Residuals:

title: find_pattern — find_pattern
text: which_files character vector file extensions check. dir starting directory iterative search performed fun string name pattern search

title: fpvalue — fpvalue
code: fpvalue(p, digits = 3, omit.p = FALSE, tex = FALSE, wrap = NULL)

title: fpvalue — fpvalue
text: p numeric. p value format digits numeric. number digits p value printed . omit.p logical. string "p ..." omitted (e.g., table header already "p") tex logical. TRUE, latex math symbols used wrap character. string pasted final p value. Default `NULL` thus empty string. `NULL` `tex` `TRUE` `$` symbol used.

title: fpvalue — fpvalue
code: fpvalue(0.0001, tex = TRUE) #> [1] "$p \\leq 0.001$" fpvalue(0.001, tex = FALSE) #> [1] "p = 0.001"

title: frames_to_dur — frames_to_dur
text: nframes number frames refresh_rate monitor refresh rate (e.g. 60)

what: Plot the result of a pnorm function call — ggnorm

text: Plot result pnorm function. syntax pnorm function.

title: Plot the result of a pnorm function call — ggnorm
code: ggnorm(q = NULL, mean = 0, sd = 1, lower.tail = TRUE, within = TRUE)

title: Plot the result of a pnorm function call — ggnorm
text: q numeric; quantile evaluate pnorm mean numeric; mean normal distribution sd numeric; standard deviation normal distribution lower.tail logical; TRUE (default), probabilities \(P[X \le x]\) otherwise, \(P[X > x]\).

title: Plot the result of a pnorm function call — ggnorm
Plot the result of a pnorm function call — ggnorm
code: ggnorm(0.5, 0, 1, lower.tail = TRUE) #> Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the filor package. #>   Please report the issue to the authors.

title: wald_test — wald_test
code: wald_test(x, h0 = 0, btt = NULL, alternative = "two.sided", alpha = 0.05)

title: wald_test — wald_test
text: x model. Currently supported classes `lmerMod`, `glmerMod`, `lm` `glm` h0 vector null hypothesis, default 0 btt vector coefficents names test. Default `NULL` (coefficients) alternative character indicating side hypothesis alpha alpha level, default 0.05

title: wald_test — wald_test
code: fit <- lm(Sepal.Lenght ~ Species, data = iris) #> Error in eval(predvars, data, env): object 'Sepal.Lenght' not found wald_test(fit) #> Error: object 'fit' not found

text: file character indicate input file input_bib character indicate input .bib file output_bib character indicate output .bib file get_file logical raw file invisibly returned
